            I study how we navigate the great blooming buzzing confusion of the social world.
            Misadventurer; reluctant optimist; amor fati.
            My name is 손재영. In English, I go by Jae.Learn more about Korean naming conventions here.Hear how my full name is pronounced here.
            
              "One-dimensional thought is systematically promoted by the makers of politics and their purveyors of mass information.
              Their universe of discourse is populated by self-validating hypotheses which, incessantly and monopolistically repeated,
              become hypnotic definitions or dictations." -Herbert Marcuse.

              Misadventurer; reluctant optimist; amor fati.
              My name is 손재영. In English, I go by Jae.Learn more about Korean naming conventions here.Hear how my full name is pronounced here.
              
                "One-dimensional thought is systematically promoted by the makers of politics and their purveyors of mass information.
                Their universe of discourse is populated by self-validating hypotheses which, incessantly and monopolistically repeated,
                become hypnotic definitions or dictations." -Herbert Marcuse.

articles.title: Publications
articles.contents:
Download CV | Google Scholar
Publications
Son, J., Bhandari, A., & FeldmanHall, O. (accepted). Cognitive maps of social features enable flexible inference in social networks. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.
Heffner, J., Son, J., & FeldmanHall, O. (accepted). Emotion prediction errors guide socially adaptive behavior. Nature Human Behaviour.Online (preprint)
Son, J., Bhandari, A., & FeldmanHall, O. (2019). Crowdsourcing punishment: Individuals reference group preferences to inform their own punitive decisions. Scientific Reports.Online (Open Access) | PDF | Data & Code
FeldmanHall, O., Son, J., & Heffner, J. (2018). Norms and the flexibility of moral action. Personality Neuroscience.Online (Open Access) | PDF
Unpublished Work
Williams, W.C., Leong, Y.C., Collier, E.A., Nook, E.C., Son, J., & Zaki, J. (preprint). Communicating emotion through facial expressions: Social consequences and neural correlates. PsyArXiv.Online (preprint)
Son, J. (in prep). Abstraction underlies learning of social network structure.


  Disclaimer: The PDFs provided may be copyrighted by the journals/edited volumes

  timely distribution of scientific knowledge, and is therefore intended for your
  personal use only. No commercial use may be made of these articles, nor is mass
  production of these articles permitted.

articles.title: Tutorials
articles.contents:
This page provides a structured directory of tutorials suitable for beginner-level programmers. It is not a full directory of all tutorials I’ve ever written. To see a more comprehensive list, check out the blog entries tagged with “tutorials”.
Language-free introductions
No-code introduction to programming
GitHub (coming soon…)
R / tidyverse
Setup guide for R tutorials
Installing R / RStudio
Creating a GitHub account / installing GitHub Desktop
How to fork/clone the tutorials

into-the-tidyverse
Learn how to work with data using the tidyverse ecosystem
Prerequisite: Setup guide

learning-stats-backwards
Learn how to perform basic regression analyses using R
Prerequisite: into-the-tidyverse

HDDM (Python)
2021 Carney Computational Modeling Workshop
PsychToolbox (Matlab)
2018 PsychToolbox Workshop
